snippet: Members of the Brotherhood, now outlawed and underground, said they were trying to bolster their ranks for a long struggle against Egypt’s military-backed government.
abstract: Muslim Brotherhood, now outlawed under Egypt's military-backed government, has fallen back on organizational structure that sustained it for decades as a banned and secretive movement; group's leaders, having returned underground, are refocusing on a protracted, grinding struggle.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo, and Asmaa al Zohairy from Fayoum.

lead_paragraph: Members of the Brotherhood, now outlawed and underground, said they were trying to bolster their ranks for a long struggle against Egypt’s military-backed government.

headline.main: The Muslim Brotherhood, Back in a Fight to Survive
headline.print_headline: The Muslim Brotherhood, Back in a Fight to Survive

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
